title: Course Home
text:
Welcome to the course website for “Programmation en R” (STS_ST07_Programming_in R).
Please read the course guidelines.
The best environment to learn the R programming language, is R. Therefore, this course is organized as an R programming workshop. from the first session on, we will engage in executing specific tasks in R, while learning new parts of the R programming language every week. We will use a program called swirl to provide immediate assessment and helpful feedback in R as you work through the lessons.
Each session will alternate between (1) a few swirl lessons of 15-20 min (2) a summary of the most important newly acquired aspects, some extra information, and best practice guidelines (3) an assignment that will repeat much of the material of the lesson, but with new data and without the feedback from swirl.
Please, make sure that you have, before the the start of our first session, R installed on your computer.
You will find some guidelines for the installation of R here. You can work directly in the R console or in RStudio. But in order to run swirl, you must have R 3.1.0 or later installed.

title: Course Home
text:
Requirements for EDSTS Credit Validation
To earn credit for this course, you must meet all of the following requirements:

Attend all sessions on Zoom

You must be logged into the Zoom meeting for the entire duration of each session (unless you have a valid justification).
You must sign in using your real name, with your full last name spelled out.
If you are unable to attend a session, you must provide a justification to both the instructor and the doctoral school.

Complete all required swirl lessons

All swirl lessons listed below must be completed by Friday, January 31 at 6:00 PM.

text:
Step 2 (optional): Get RStudio
In addition to R, it’s recommended that you install RStudio, which will make your experience with R much more enjoyable.
If you need to install RStudio, you can do so here. Select the appropriate installer for your operating system.

title: Course Guidelines
text:
Step 3: Install swirl
You only need to do this once.
Open RStudio (or just plain R if you don’t have RStudio) and type the following into the console:
> install.packages("swirl")
Note that the > symbol at the beginning of the line is R’s prompt for you type something into the console. We include it here so you know that this command is to be typed into the console and not elsewhere. The part you type begins after >.
